title: DIY JADAM Wetting Agent(JWA) 20L for Gardeners. Natural liquid soap. Homemade pesticide

tasks.task: Make natural wetting agent (JADAM) and use it as an insecticide.
subtasks: Measure 3.6 liters of canola oil.
Measure 640 grams of 90% pure potassium hydroxide.
Obtain soft water (e.g., rainwater, dehumidifier water, distilled water).
Weigh 500 grams of soft water for initial process.
Add 640 grams of potassium hydroxide to the measured water.
Stir the mixture to dissolve the potassium hydroxide.
Add 3.6 liters of canola oil to the mixture.
Blend the oil until the mixture turns into a thin cream (about 5 minutes).
Let the mixture age for 3 days (or 24 hours in a rush), ensuring the temperature rises and stabilizes.
Check for proper aging by ensuring there are no separate layers; adjust if necessary by re-blending.
Add 4 liters of water to the aged solution to cleave it, then split into small particles.
Use a hand blender to blend the solution thoroughly.
Add 12 liters of water and stir occasionally over 24 hours.
Use an electric drill with low RPM to speed up the melting process if desired.
Store the melted JADAM wetting agent in a bottle or bucket with a lid.
Use the JADAM wetting agent as an insecticide in agricultural practices.

Make the JADAM wetting agent
subtasks: Measure 3.6 liters of canola oil.
Measure 640 grams of 90% pure potassium hydroxide.
Measure 500 grams of soft water.
Dissolve the potassium hydroxide in the measured soft water and stir until dissolved.
Add the canola oil to the dissolved potassium hydroxide and blend until the mixture turns into a thin cream.
Age the mixture for 3 days and check the temperature (should be over 80°C).
If the mixture separates, re-blend it for 20 minutes.
Add 4 liters of water to the aged mixture and use a hand blender to mix thoroughly (if necessary).
Wait 24 hours to allow the mixture to melt completely.
Top up with 12 liters of water and blend again using a drill if needed (use low RPM to prevent overflow).
Store the finished product in a bottle with a lid.

Make natural wetting agent (JADAM) and use it as an insecticide.
subtasks: Measure 3.6 liters of canola oil.
Measure 640 grams of 90% pure potassium hydroxide.
Obtain soft water using rainwater, dehumidifier water, or distilled water.
Dissolve the potassium hydroxide in 500 grams of soft water and stir until dissolved.
Add 3.6 liters of canola oil to the dissolved potassium hydroxide and blend until the mixture turns into a thin cream.
Age the mixture for 3 days, monitor the temperature, and check for proper aging.
If the mixture separates, re-blend the oil and water for 20 minutes until emulsified.
Add 4 liters of water and use a hand blender to mix thoroughly.
Let the mixture sit for 24 hours to melt, then use an electric drill to accelerate the process if needed.
Add 12 liters of water and stir the mixture occasionally for 24 hours.
Store the finished JADAM wetting agent in a bottle or container with a lid.
Apply the JADAM wetting agent to crops as an insecticide.

tasks.task: Prepare the JADAM Wetting Agent and Use it as an Insecticide
Make natural wetting agent (JADAM) and use it as an insecticide.
subtasks: Measure 3.6 liters of canola oil.
Measure 640 grams of 90% pure potassium hydroxide.
Obtain soft water (e.g., rainwater, dehumidifier water).
Dissolve the potassium hydroxide in 500 grams of soft water and stir until dissolved.
Add 3.6 liters of canola oil to the dissolved potassium hydroxide and blend until the mixture turns into a thin cream.
Age the mixture for 3 days, monitor temperature, and check for proper aging.
If the mixture separates, re-blend the oil and water for 20 minutes until emulsified.
Add 4 liters of water and use a hand blender to mix thoroughly.
Let the mixture sit for 24 hours to melt, then use an electric drill to accelerate the process if needed.
Add 12 liters of water and stir the mixture occasionally for 24 hours.
Store the finished JADAM wetting agent in a bottle or container with a lid.
Apply the JADAM wetting agent to crops as an insecticide.
